concise_definition: n. 崇拜, 敬拜; v. 崇拜, 敬仰, 痴迷

definitions.explanation_en: The act of showing deep reverence, devotion, or adoration toward a deity, sacred object, or spiritual force, often through ritual, prayer, or ceremony.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对神灵、圣物或精神力量表达深切敬仰、虔诚或崇拜的行为，通常通过仪式、祈祷或典礼来实现。
definitions.example_en: The temple was filled with worshippers during the morning service.
definitions.example_cn: 早间礼拜时，寺庙里挤满了信徒。

definitions.explanation_en: Excessive admiration or devotion toward a person, idea, or thing, often to the point of idealization or obsession.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人、某种理念或事物的过度钦佩或迷恋，常达到理想化甚至痴迷的程度。
definitions.example_en: There's a cult of worship around celebrity athletes in modern media.
definitions.example_cn: 在现代媒体中，对名人运动员存在着一种近乎崇拜的狂热。

definitions.explanation_en: To honor or revere a deity or divine being through religious practices, rituals, or expressions of faith.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过宗教实践、仪式或信仰表达来敬奉或尊崇神灵或神圣存在。
definitions.example_en: Many people worship in churches, mosques, or temples according to their faith.
definitions.example_cn: 许多人根据自己的信仰在教堂、清真寺或寺庙中敬拜。

definitions.explanation_en: To admire or love someone or something intensely, often to an excessive or uncritical degree.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人或某物产生强烈钦佩或热爱，常达到过度或无批判的程度。
definitions.example_en: Teenagers often worship pop stars as if they were gods.
definitions.example_cn: 青少年常常把流行明星当作神明一样崇拜。

comparison.analysis: “Adore” (热爱/敬爱) 强调一种充满情感的、近乎痴迷的爱慕，常用于人或事物，带有强烈的个人情感色彩，但不一定涉及宗教仪式。而 “worship” 更正式、更仪式化，常用于宗教语境，或比喻性地表达极端崇拜。
“Revere” (敬重/尊崇) 指因对方的品德、地位或成就而怀有深深的尊敬，语气庄重但不包含情感上的迷恋或献身。它更理性、更克制，而 “worship” 则带有情感投入和精神臣服的意味。
“Venerate” (崇敬) 通常用于对圣人、祖先或传统表示尊敬，强调尊重与敬畏，多用于宗教或文化传统语境。它比 “worship” 更温和，不包含献祭或崇拜的仪式性行为，更偏向于精神上的敬仰。
